product_overview: The Real Estate ERP System (REMS) is a comprehensive cloud-based platform designed to streamline operations for real estate management companies. It integrates property management, tenant services, financial accounting, human resources, and CRM functionalities into a unified ERP solution to enhance operational efficiency and tenant satisfaction.
core_goals: Achieve operational efficiency by automating and streamlining real estate management workflows.
Provide real-time financial transparency with detailed accounting and reporting.
Enhance tenant satisfaction through self-service portals and timely communication.
Enable data-driven decision making via comprehensive analytics and AI-powered insights.
Ensure scalability to support growth from small portfolios to large enterprises with thousands of properties.
key_features: Authentication & Authorization with JWT and device approval.
Comprehensive Dashboard Overview with real-time metrics and charts.
Complete Properties Management including properties, units, blocks, floors, and leases.
Tenant Management with portal access, lease management, and maintenance requests.
Financial Management covering transactions, invoices, payments, accounting, and commissions.
CRM Module for leads, clients, deals, and communications tracking.
Human Resources Management including employees, attendance, payroll, and leaves.
AI Intelligence for predictive analytics and recommendations.
Notification System with real-time updates and user-specific alerts.
Role & Permissions Management with invite link generation.
Support Ticket System and File Upload functionality.
Robust API service and reusable UI components built with modern tech stack.
user_flow_summary: User Authentication via login or invite links with role-based access control and device approval workflows.
Admin and users navigate dashboard for real-time insights and actionable KPIs.
Property managers create and maintain properties, units, blocks, floors, and organize property data hierarchically.
Tenants use the portal to view their dashboard, invoices, make payments, submit maintenance requests, and access documents.
Finance team manages transactions, invoices, payments, and generates accounting vouchers and ledgers.
CRM users manage leads, convert them to clients, track deals and related communications throughout the sales pipeline.
HR personnel manage employee records, track attendance and leaves, and oversee payroll processing.
Notifications alert users about payments, lease expiries, maintenance, approvals, and system events.
Administrators configure system settings including roles, permissions, themes, and departments.
Support staff handle ticket creation and resolution workflow, with audit logs tracking all activities.
validation_criteria: All authentication flows enforce secure password hashing, JWT token validation, and device approval processes.
Property management supports CRUD operations with correct code generation and status updates for units.
Tenant portal correctly reflects tenant data and supports payment and maintenance submission workflows.
Financial transactions and invoices must adhere to accounting rules (debit-credit balance, tax calculations, payment allocation).
CRM lead and deal stages update consistently with business logic and user permissions.
HR records reflect accurate attendance, leave balances, and payroll calculations per specifications.
AI intelligence outputs credible forecasts and recommendations based on available data.
Notifications are delivered in real-time with correct unread/read counts and user-specific targeting.
Role-based access control must prevent unauthorized data access and enforce permission boundaries.
API endpoints respond correctly with proper error handling, validation, and consistent data formats.
System must perform within specified response time and scalability targets under realistic workloads.
